questions.question:
A scheduling algorithm assigns priority proportional to the waiting time of a process. Every process starts with priority zero (the lowest priority). The scheduler re-evaluates the process priorities every T time units and decides the next process to schedule. Which one of the following is TRUE if the processes have no I/O operations and all arrive at time zero?

(GATE CSE 2013)
options:
A.

This algorithm is equivalent to the first-come-first-serve algorithm.

B.

This algorithm is equivalent to the round-robin algorithm.

C.

This algorithm is equivalent to the shortest-job-first algorithm.

D.

This algorithm is equivalent to the shortest-remaining-time-first algorithm.
questions.correct_answer:
B.

This algorithm is equivalent to the round-robin algorithm.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the 3 processes, P1, P2 and P3 shown in the table.

The completion order of the 3 processes under the policies FCFS and RR2 (round robin scheduling with CPU quantum of 2 time units) are

(GATE CSE 2012)
options:
A.

FCFS: P1, P2, P3 RR2: P1, P2, P3

B.

FCFS: P1, P3, P2 RR2: P1, P3, P2

C.

FCFS: P1, P2, P3 RR2: P1, P3, P2

D.

FCFS: P1, P3, P2 RR2: P1, P2, P3
questions.correct_answer:
C.

FCFS: P1, P2, P3 RR2: P1, P3, P2
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
In a system using single processor, a new process arrives at the rate of six processes per minute and each such process requires seven seconds of service time. What is the CPU utilization?

(ISRO CSE 2011)

questions.question:
Belady's anomaly means

(ISRO CSE 2011)
options:
A.

Page fault rate is constant even on increasing the number of allocated frames

B.

Page fault rate may increase on increasing the number of allocated frames

C.

Page fault rate may increase on decreasing the number of allocated frames

D.

Page fault rate may decrease on increasing the number of allocated frames
questions.correct_answer:
B.

Page fault rate may increase on increasing the number of allocated frames

questions.question:
With Round-Robin CPU scheduling in a time shared system

(ISRO CSE 2008)
options:
A.

using very large time slices (quantas) degenerates into First-Come First served (FCFS) algorithm.

B.

using extremely small time slices improves performance

C.

using very small time slices degenerates into Last-In First-Out (LIFO) algorithm.

D.

using medium sized times slices leads to shortest Request time First (SRTF) algorithm
questions.correct_answer:
A.

using very large time slices (quantas) degenerates into First-Come First served (FCFS) algorithm.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

C.

are used to favour real time tasks
